Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black-figured pottery kantharos; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; two added white bands; exterior: broad black band at rim; below, black-figure decoration consisting of cock (lower body and tail missing; added red on neck and white on body) to left; at left, undetermined motif partly in white.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 333, no. 1632)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1895) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
